TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to Jose Antonio Saucedo, 07-17-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Saucedo, July 17, 1826. Asks instructions concerning procedure for legal separation of husband and wife.

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Saucedo, July 17, 1826. Asks instructions concerning procedure for legal separation of husband and wife.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*I am under the necessity of consulting Your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*in relation to a legal case which arose in this jurisdiction, and to request you to give me your instructions as to the mode of proceeding which will be in conformity to the laws of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*One of the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*behaves so badly toward his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*, that she can not bear his ill usage any longer. He is a *person_mentioned*drunkard*/person_mentioned* and if there are no means of preventing him, will soon squander all the property they have. The *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*is composed of his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*and three *person_mentioned*daughters*/person_mentioned*; the property consists principally of *person_mentioned*slaves*/person_mentioned*, furniture and cattle, to the amount of 7 or 8,000 dollars, all of which belongs to the *person_mentioned*wife*/person_mentioned*, as is shown by legal titles of possession. He received *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*here as a *person_mentioned*colonist*/person_mentioned*, but having neglected to cultivate it as is required by law, he forfeits his right. Now, *person_mentioned*she */person_mentioned*wishes to be separated from him and to take possession of *location_mentioned*her property*/location_mentioned* for her own and her *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*'s support. He refuses to permit her to do so, and threatens to take the *person_mentioned*negroes */person_mentioned*to the *location_mentioned*United States of the North*/location_mentioned*; she is even apprehensive of her personal security. I have neither *location_mentioned*jail */location_mentioned*nor guard, nor the means of securing men of his character and disposition. In his intoxication he treats me and the other *person_mentioned*public officers*/person_mentioned* of this jurisdiction with contempt.*/p*
*p*As I am unacquainted with the law in such cases, and the form of proceeding therein, I request your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*to instruct me on the subject; and, also, to tell me what I have to do with those who, when intoxicated, abuse, and speak contemptuously of the *person_mentioned*authorities*/person_mentioned*. If such conduct is tolerated all respect will be lost and good order can not be enforced. The actual cause of these offences is, that these *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*are aware that we have no means of confining them, and, they say, the laws do not allow the punishment of flogging, and they have no money to pay a fine. What am I to do with such bad *person_mentioned*characters*/person_mentioned*, who ought to be punished for disturbing the peace, and appearing, publicly, in a state of drunkenness?*/p* *p*God and Liberty.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*.
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="07-17-1826">July 17th 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
